}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "109-700-9100" and "WX5514_V04" is silkscreened on the main board of a production unit. :The board shown in the FCC photos has two Mini PCI slots, but the un-used slot seems to be omitted on (at least some) production models. Likewise, the UART circuitry is omitted, though it is also omitted in the FCC docs. "WL535AG" and "109-501-5200" seems to be soldered on the wireless module on a production unit. :The U.FL connectors also seem to be omitted on the wireless module, opting for direct soldering to the card.
OEM: [[Gemtek]] WX-5514, same Gemtek part as the [[Linksys WRT51AB]]. :The default SSID may be '''default'''. The FCC manual states it is '''linksys'''.
The power adapter shown in the FCC photos is a '''Linksys''' MS15-050250-A1D (100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.5A -> 5VDC, 2.5A).
This device may use U-NII-2 channels but does not implement DFS since it predates the FCC requirements.
==Links of Interest== ===Forum threads=== *[http://wl500g.info/showthread.php?301-Asus-WL-500a-Yes!&p=2449#post2449 ''Linksys WRT54AG'' on '''wl500g''' forums] ([http://web.archive.org/web/20060222014538/http://members.chello.nl/~m.kuystermans/LinksysWRT54AG.jpg PCB image]) :RAM: ''ProMOS'' V54C3128164VAT6 (16MB) *[http://www.dslreports.com/forum/r11588261-WRT54AG-not-WRT55AG-does-not-support-WPA-WPA2 ''Linksys WRT54AG'' on '''DSLReports''' forums] :[[Linksys WRT55AG v1]] - [[Broadcom]] B/G + [[Atheros]] A
===Additional external links=== *[http://www.anderson-net.com/~nathan/wrt54ag/ Hacking the Linksys WRT54AG]
